alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 22 at 1:27PM PST until January 23 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST TONIGHT... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, minor beach erosion and minor tidal overflow. Breaking waves of 3 to 6 feet are still possible into the evening. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...Until midnight PST tonight. * IMPACTS...Pooling of sea water is possible around high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. Minor beach erosion is also possible. No significant damage is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The time of greatest concern will be during morning high tide which will range between 7.0 and 7.3 feet between 730 AM and 900 AM this weekend.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
